column4: somebody help me recompile my kernel with module suport please
which i don't want it to do
i had to edit a driver
The config file for your running stock kernel is in /boot
can i just vi that and not have to change all the other options?
You can copy it to your kernel source dir, then start from there. All defaults will be preselected.
copy it as /usr/src/kernel-source/.config... Whatever your kernel source dir is.
that way can i just change a single option/
If that's all you need, then yes. This assumes the same sources as your running kernel.
If you are going to compile a newer kernel that what that config was made from, do a "make oldconfig".
